What is Mindfulness Meditation?

Meditation is a form of enlightenment where one reaches a clear and pristine level of awareness. It\'s a journey to reach the destination of our working mind. This is where the practice of meditation and mindfulness meet at the crossroad. The focus is on the now. No longer are there worries about the past or the future. The path is the present moment. Mindfulness is a way of life where there are no distractions. There is no judgment. Having the ability to be self-aware of our surroundings. Through meditation, becoming mindful helps slow down every moment where they can be savored.

There are many meditation practices but what makes meditation so great is that there isn\'t a perfect way to achieve its offerings. Whether young or old, meditation is a tool for anyone practicing self-care.

The Benefits of Meditation

  • Greatly increases mindfulness
  • Lowers stress levels
  • Controls anxiety
  • Promotes emotional health
  • Reduction of negative feelings
  • Reduces implicit age & race bias
  • Improves sleep
  • Can decrease blood pressure
  • Deeper relaxation
  • Raises sustained attention
  • Decreases feelings & symptoms of depression
  • Enhances gratitude & self-awareness
  • Boosts self-discovery

There are other meditation techniques that exist that can help any particular domain of life. Mindfulness meditation is only the start.

Should you Start Journaling?

There is a reason that journaling has become so popular. Human beings like the essence of feeling productive. The achievement of checking something off the to-do list. Keeping a journal is much more than that. Journaling allows us to dump all of our current feelings and move on from them. It documents our current frequency. It documents our love. It documents our experiences. By documenting these things, an organization of thoughts is occurring. The mind is always thinking but at the end of the day, look back at all the good things that happened. Revisit those enjoyable and fantastic events. This is where journaling is unique for everyone.

Gratitude journal

Through the practice of gratitude, one\'s mind can grow into a million channels of happier states. By recalling what we are grateful for, this also builds upon mindfulness. It\'s an exercise for the mind to take in the present moment. What we have right now to be thankful for. This guides us through the path of appreciation and thankfulness. Certain situations can make this difficult but allotting the time to even jot a few things down each day or even once a week can bring us back to the correct frequency that we need to be on.

Bullet journal

Keeping a bullet journal allows for one to stay on track with daily routines, goals, events to participate in, etc. At the beginning of every month, plan and compile all the information into one central location. Have your goals, bills, special plans, dates, or lunch with a friend all included. That way each day can be truly focused upon.

Customization and creativity allow for a custom page here and there throughout the month. There might be a certain area of self-care that needs improving such as personal self-care. This could include exercising more, changing your diet, picking up a new hobby, getting proper sleep or just spending more "me time". Being able to write down these things helps remove worry and stress that can seem to pile up.

Self love

Love is the basis of self-care. As we continue our daily lives, self-love is how we take care of ourselves. We must know how to love ourselves in many ways that are meaningful. Take action to really discover one\'s self. Do things that make you happy. Do things where you come first.

Set aside some time to reward yourself no matter how small the success. We strive to better ourselves and become a better person. So when failure strikes, give yourself a break. Allow this as a time to grow and evolve. Look at gratitude to bring up your frequency and give your vibration a positive boost.

Major Actions

  • Mindfulness
  • Spiritual Connection
  • Good Feelings and Positive Emotion
  • The Law of Attraction
  • Love

Music Soothes the Soul

Music is a part of every culture and there is good reasoning. Music instantly sways our emotions. This is because whenever we hear a song that we particularly like, the brain releases a chemical called dopamine which is often known as the feel-good hormone. There is the physiological rush of happiness or joy.

Individual songs often serve as a bookmark for moments in our lives. They are tied to certain memories. Whether it was a song from your childhood or a new hit single that is topping the charts. These songs signify a sense of bonding. A bonding of current culture, styles, and unique decades.

The benefits of music can range from improved mood to pain release. So whether we listen to our favorite music on our daily commute, singing a song at a karaoke bar, or appreciating a historical composer such as Ludwig van Beethoven, try to incorporate music into your daily self-care routine.

Mother Nature

In the time of concrete jungles, we are spending our time inside man-made structures. The importance of escaping the everyday world cannot be stressed enough. Reuniting with nature gives us the opportunity to…

  • improve our mood
  • gain clarity and mental energy
  • reduce anxiety
  • relieve stress
  • realign of natural rhythm
  • increase mindfulness

Everyone doesn't live next to the prime nature spot but it doesn't have to be. Simply going for a walk, visiting a local park, or even caring for a garden can realign us with nature. We need the excuse to disconnect. So try to plan a weekend getaway here and there to get more greenery in your life. Whether a backpacking trip and camping aligns or visiting a lake to take in the scene, there are plenty of ways to take in mother nature.

Self Love Diet

Putting your ego on a strict diet often results in catastrophe. A self-love diet is about eating mindfully. This is coming into portion control. Eat the amount that your body is physically hungry for. During this time, take in the flavors and be happy about what you\'re eating. When one is focused on self-love, a healthy nutritional diet will become a lot easier than forcing perfection and shame.

Humans are creatures of emotion. The food that we eat often relate to how we are feeling. As we notice our feelings and the differences we feel when we eat a nourishing meal compared to an unhealthy one. There will be a greater urge to continue down the more nourishing path. We like to feel good so trust your body. If there is a craving for something, eat what satisfies the craving but look deeper afterward. There shouldn't be any judgment but how did eating that item makes your body feel? Make a note of how you feel afterward to help you decide about the next time you think about eating it.

Dieting often falls into what is the latest and greatest fad diet. Often dieting is based on the results that we see on the outside and often forget about the internal changes. Follow routines and diets that make you feel alive. A diet that fills you with energy. Be internally aware and listen to your body. There are signs that we ignore because our goal is having the perfect body, or losing a bunch of weight. That goal can still exist but achieve it in a self-loving and healthy way. Move at your own pace but there should always be an effort to pamper our temple that holds our soul.

Escape Your Comfort Zone

There is something magical about traveling. The magic comes when you leave familiarity behind and take the opportunity to discover what else is out there. Stagnation often makes our lives fly by in a blink of an eye but it doesn\'t have to be that way.

Traveling allows us to reconnect with ourselves. Having the time to escape our daily routines and differentiate your self-care practices. Take a different path of fulfillment. At the end of a current adventure, take with you all of the things that you have discovered. Share your experience with others to keep these feelings fresh. Look back and be grateful that we live in such a beautiful world with fantastic people to share it with.

Do the things that you love. Everyone is unique in their own way and people have different self-love and self-care techniques. In a social media crazed world, we can't help but to compare ourselves with others but living the life that you deserve is priority number one. Traveling has its own definition based on the individual. Whether that includes international travel, state or providence travel. Plan an adventure that is pioneered around what you love.

Essential Oils

Essential oils are a must to boost your self-care. These oils are nothing more than plant extracts and are closely related to aromatherapy. Typically they are used with an oil diffuser but can be used in your bath or shower, skin care and cleaning products, and even replacing the air freshener with an oil spray that can refresh a room.

Special Self Care Needs

  • Sleep - chamomile, lavender, marjoram, sandalwood, and vetiver
  • Mental Clarity - basil, clary sage, juniper berry, lemon and rosemary
  • Stress Relief - clary sage, eucalyptus, peppermint, and tea tree

Once again another area of self-care is focusing on nature and bringing it into our space. There are many more needs that essential oils can aid with. A lot of the benefits compound on one another so keep that in mind when you're picking your oils.
